paper_metadata.title: Mutational analysis of BRCA1 and BRCA2 in hereditary breast and ovarian cancer families from Asturias (Northern Spain)
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for BRCA2, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: median age 48 for breast cancer (range 32–74), median age 52 for ovarian cancer (range 48–60)
patients.phenotype: 10 breast cancers, 3 ovarian cancers, 1 squamous oesophagus cancer

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In the eleven carriers identified, a total of ten breast cancers, three ovarian cancers and one squamous oesophagus cancer have been diagnosed.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the families.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on multiple affected individuals.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is the most frequent BRCA2 mutation in the study.
key_quotes: The novel truncating mutation c.4030_4035delinsC (p.Asn1344Hisfs), shared by 6 families, is BRCA2 most frequent mutation in our series and accounts for 30% of the BRCA2 mutations.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the families.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was identified in three Asturian families.
key_quotes: The second most frequent novel mutation in BRCA2 was c.2095 C>T (p.Gln699*) identified in three Asturian families.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The following novel truncating mutations were found in one family each: c.262_263delCT (p.Leu88Alafs).

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.

key_quotes: The following novel truncating mutations were found in one family each: c.3263dupC (p.Gln1089Serfs).

key_quotes: The following novel truncating mutations were found in one family each: c.8042_8043delCA (p.Thr2681Serfs).

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the families.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is very common in Western Europe.
key_quotes: Two families carried the mutation c.1813dupA (p.Ile605Asnfs), which is very common in Western Europe.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The other 6 known mutations were found in one family each. The c.5116_5119delAATA (p.Asn1706Leufs) mutation, recurrent in Castilla-León, was found in two families originally from that area.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The other 6 known mutations were found in one family each. The c.9310_9311delAA (p.Lys3104Valfs) mutation, recurrent in Castilla-León, was found in two families originally from that area.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The pathogenic mutation c.5576_5579delTTAA (p.Ile1859Lysfs) was found in one family from the País Vasco.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The pathogenic mutation c.4631dupA (p.Asn1544Lysfs) has also been described in Western European populations.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a frameshift.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: The frame-shift c.9026_9030delATCAT (p.Tyr3009Serfs), which is a founder mutation originating in the Northeast of Spain, was identified in one family from Cantabria.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is a truncating mutation leading to a stop codon.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregated with disease in the family.
variants.evidence_level: moderate evidence based on family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation was found in one family.
key_quotes: An African American woman with early onset bilateral breast cancer carried the nonsense mutation c.2830A>T (p.Lys944*).

tables_processed.table_caption: Germ line BRCA2 pathogenic mutations in breast and ovarian cancer families from Asturias

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants and penetrance data were successfully extracted.
